intro: Microlicia obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
